\num{2} aDaku; aDacu; ototxtAtxgi iDu: \eng{as neat and close as nature packs her blossoms} nisagaRvu goMcalinalilx hUgaLanunx acucxkaTATxgi, ototxtAtxgi aDakuvaMte. \eng{packed a lot into a few hours} kelaveV gaMTegaLanunx bahaLa kAyaRkarxmagaLiMda tuMbida. \eng{passengers packed like sardines} sADiRVnf miVnugaLaMte aDakida parxyANikaru. 
\num{3} (saBAMgaNa, raMgamaMdira, \mo vanunx) shorxVtaqgaLiMda yA perxVkaSxkariMda -- giDi; kikikxriyuvaMte tuMbu: \eng{hall packed to capacity} saMpUNaRvAgi -- iDikirida, kikikxridu tuMbihoVda saBAmaMdira. \eng{the restaurant was packed} resoTxrAMTu kikikxridu tuMbitutx. 
\num{4} (\kaparx dalilx) tuMbiru; vAyxpakavAgi hoMdiru, oLagoMDiru: \eng{the book is packed with information} pusatxkavu mAhitigaLiMda tuMbide. 
\num{5} (padAthaR \mo vanunx) sutatxlU bigiyAgi kaTiTxniMda, paTiTxyiMda, AvaraNadiMda, hodikeyiMda -- kaTuTx, mucucx, hodisu: \eng{pack the trees so that they may grow well} maragaLu cenAnxgi beLeyuvaMte (beVru \mo vanunx mucicx) avugaLige paTiTx hAki bigi. 
\numi{6} (\AmA) 
\banum
\alnum{a} (baMdUku \mo vanunx) koMDoyuyx; hotutxkoMDu hoVgu. 
\alnum{b} kushalavAgi yA balavAgi (Dikikx, gududx) koDuva shakitxyiru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} (mAMsa, haNuNx, \mo vanunx hecucx kAla keDadaMtiDalu) saMsakxrisiDu; takakxMte saMsakxrisi Dababx \mo vugaLalilx tuMbiDu. 
\num{8} (beVTe nAyigaLanunx yA ragibx kAlecxMDATada muMcUNiyavaranunx) guMpAgisu; taMDagUDisu. 
\num{9} (isipxVTu elegaLanunx) kaTuTxgUDisu. 
\num{10} (\veYshA) (aMga \mo vakekx odedx baTeTx \mo vanunx) sututx; kaTuTx; paTiTx hAku; hodesu. 
\num{11} (muSiTxkALaga \ashi) (balavAda, sariyAda hoDeta) koDu; hAku; muSiTxyiMda gududx: \eng{he packs a better punch than his rival} tananx edurALigiMta avanu hecucx balavAda gududx koDabalalx. 
\num{12} (sathxLa, pAterx, \mo vakekx) balavAgi -- giDi, turuku, otitx tuMbu: \eng{pack a trunk} peTiTxgeyoLakekx turuki tuMbu. 
\num{13} (pArxNiya meVle) hore heVru. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} aDakiru; aDaciru; ototxtAtxgiru. 
\num{2} (ragibx muMcUNiya ATagArara \vi) guMpugUDu; guMpAgu. 
\num{3} (sAmAnu cenAnxgi, sulaBavAgi) mUTe kaTaTxlAgu; mUTe kaTaTxlu baru; mUTege aDakavAgu: \eng{it packs easily} adu sulaBavAgi kaTaTxlu barutatxde. 
\num{4} (pArxNigaLa \vi) hiMDAgu; guMpugUDu; hiMDugUDu. 
\num{5} (\sA\ \AtAmx) gaMTumUTe kaTiTxkoMDu horaDu: \eng{he lost no time in packing himself} avanu kUDaleV gaMTumUTe kaTiTx horaTa. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{packed out} (\AmA) kikikxrida; BatiR tuMbihoVda. 
\num{2} \eng{pack it in} (\engit{or} \eng{up)} (\AmA) (kelasa \mo vanunx) nililxsibiDu; keYbiDu; mugisu; konegANisu. 
\num{3} \eng{pack on all sail} (\nw) (doVNi \mo vugaLa veVga hecicxsalu) elAlx (hAyi)paTagaLanUnx hArisu, Erisu. 
\num{4} \eng{pack (person) off} (obabx vayxkitxyanunx) kaLuhisibiDu; horaDisibiDu; sAgahAku; ravAnisu; Acege aTuTx; horakekx dabubx: \eng{he packed her off to village at once} avanu avaLanunx kUDaleV haLiLxge sAgahAkidanu. 
\numi{5} \eng{pack up} (\AmA) 
\banum
\alnum{a} (\kanmu\ yaMtarxda \vi) keTuTx niMtuhoVgu: \eng{one of the engines packed up} eMjinfgaLalilx oMdu keTuTx niMtuhoVyitu. 
\alnum{b} gaMTu mUTe kaTuTx; oMdu sapxdheR, kelasa, \mo vugaLiMda -- hiMdirugu, vApasAgu, viramisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{send (person) packing} (obabxnanunx) hiMdumuMdu noVDade, taDabaDavilalxde kelasadiMda tegeduhAku, manege kaLuhisibiDu. 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\bentry

\noindent

\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (vasutx \mo vanunx) pakakxkekx biTuTxhoVgu; hiMde biTuTxhoVgu; dATihoVgu. 
\num{2} (\kanmu\ vAhanadalilx) dATi muMde hoVgu.

\num{4} oMdu vayxkitxyiMda yA sathxLadiMda inonxbabxrige yA inonxMdakekx vagARyisu, sAgisu: \eng{pass the butter} beNeNxyanunx muMdinavanige sAgisu. 
\num{5} (sapxdheRyalilx) miVrisu; muMduvari; hiMdakekx hAku. 
\num{6} miVru; atiVtavAgiru: \eng{it passes my comprehension} adu nananx garxhikeyanunx, tiLivaLikeyanunx miVrutatxde. 
\num{7} sAgisu; ravAnisu: \eng{a canal sufficient to pass boats of 25 tons} ipapxtetxYdu Tanf tUkada doVNigaLanunx sAgisabahudAda nAle. 
\num{8} ADisu; calisu: \eng{passed his hand across his forehead} avanu keYyanunx tananx haNeya meVle ADisidanu. \eng{pass your eye over this letter} I kAgadada meVle ninanx kaNuNx hAyisu, kaNoNxVDisu. 
\num{9} hoVguvaMte mADu; hAyisu; kaLisu: \eng{pass a rope round it} adara sutatx hagagxvanunx hAyisu. 
\num{10} (kAlecxMDu, hAki, \mo\ ATagaLalilx) tananx kaDeya ATagAranige ceMDanunx odedu, hoDedu, esedu -- sAgisu, kaLuhisu (\akirx\ saha). 
\num{11} (pakakxdalilx) hAduhoVguvaMte mADu: \eng{pass troops in review} parishiVlanegAgi seVnAdaLagaLanunx shisitxniMda hAduhoVguvaMte mADu, meravaNigeyalilx naDesu. 
\num{12} (shAsanasaBeyalilx kAyidege yA masUdege) (parishiVlaneya naMtara) aMgiVkAra niVDu; anumoVdane, opipxge koDu; maMjUru mADu; maMjUrAguvaMte mADu; pAsumADu. 
\num{13} (kAla, Qutu, \mo vanunx) kaLe: \eng{pass the afternoon reading} OdutAtx madhAyxhanxvanunx kaLe. 
\num{14} muMdakekx kaLuhisu; vagARyisu: \eng{read this and pass it on} idanunx Odi muMdakekx, muMdinavanige kaLuhisu. 
\num{15} (nANayxvanunx, \kanmu\ KoVTAnANayxvanunx) calAvaNe mADu. 
\num{16} BASekoDu; ANeyiTuTx heVLu; parxmANa mADi heVLu; mAtu koDu; vAgAdxna mADu: \eng{pass one's word of honour to remain loyal} tAnu niSeThxyiMdiruveneMdu parxmANamADi heVLu, vacanakoDu. 
\num{17} (vimasheR, tiVpuR) heVLu; koDu; niVDu: \eng{I can't pass an opinion on your work without seeing it} ninanx kaqtiyanunx noVDade adara bagegx nananx aBipArxyavanunx koDalAre. 
\num{18} (pariVkeSxyanunx) pAsumADu; (adaralilx) yashasivxyAgu: \eng{passed the degree examination} padavi pariVkeSxyanunx pAsumADida. 
\num{19} (pariVkaSxkana \vi) (aBayxthiRyanunx) pAsumADisu; (avanu mADiruvudu) taqpitxkaravAgide, sariyAgide eMdu tiVmARnisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} muMdakekx hoVgu, naDe; hAyi; dATu; sAgu; muMduvari; hAduhoVgu: \eng{please let me pass} dayaviTuTx nanage muMdakekx hoVguvudakekx hAdibiDu, avakAsha mADikoDu. 
\num{2} calAvaNeyAgu; calAvaNeyalilxru; salulx; saluvaLiyAgu; cAlitxyalilxru: \eng{bank notes pass so long as nobody refuses them} elilxyavarege bAyxMku noVTugaLanunx yArU tirasakxrisuvudilalxvoV alilxyavarege avu calAvaNeyAgutatxve. 
\num{3} eDeyiMdeDege sAgu: \eng{from the college he passed to the novitiate} avanu kAleVjiniMda navashiSAyxlayakekx sAgidanu. 
\num{4} (oMdu sithxtiyiMda matotxMdu sithxtige) badalAyisu; badalAgu; mApaRDu: \eng{when water boils it passes into steam} niVru kudiyuvAga adu AviyAgi badalAyisutatxde. 
\num{5} sAyi; tiVriko; gatisu; maqtihoMdu: \eng{passed from among us} namamxnunx biTuTx tiVrihoVda, kAlavAda. 
\num{6} sAgu; hoVgu: \eng{time passes rapidly} kAla shiVGarxvAgi sAgutatxde. 
\num{7} konegANu; gatisihoVgu: \eng{kingdoms and nations pass} rAjayxgaLU rASaTxrXgaLU gatisihoVgutatxve. 
\num{8} dArimADikoMDu hoVgu; parxveVshisu; taTAyisikoMDu hoVgu: \eng{permitted no one to pass} yAranUnx oLage parxveVshisalu biDalilalx. 
\num{9} AkeSxVpaNegoLagAgade hoVgu: \eng{such conduct may pass in certain circles but cannot be tolerated} aMtha vataRne kelavu valayagaLalilx AkeSxVpaNegoLagAgade hoVgabahudu, Adare adanunx sahisalAguvudilalx. 
\num{10} (shAsanasaBeyalilx masUde, salahe \mo vu) aMgiVkaqtavAgu; maMjUrAgu; anumoVdane paDe: \eng{the bill passed without alteration} masUdeyu yAva badalAvaNeyilalxde aMgiVkaqtavAyitu. 
\num{11} (aBayxthiR) teVgaRDeyAgu; pAsAgu; utitxVNaRnAgu: \eng{of the twenty who took the exam, only twelve passed} pariVkeSxyanunx tegedukoMDa ipapxtatxralilx keVvala hanenxraDu maMdi teVgaRDeyAdaru. 
\num{12} Agu; naDe; saMBavisu; heVLalapxDu; mADalapxDu: \eng{I heard what was passing} Enu naDeyutitxdidxteMbudanunx nAnu keVLide. 
\num{13} tiVpuRkoDu; niNaRyakoDu: \eng{the judge did not pass on the constitutional question} nAyxyAdhiVshanu saMvidhAnAtamxka parxshenxya meVle tiVpuRkoDalilalx. 
\num{14} (tiVpiRna \vi) (PiyARdi \mo vara paravAgi) tiVpARgu. 
\numi{15} (isipxVTATa) 
\banum
\alnum{a} (ATa heVLuva) avakAsha biTuTxkoDu; ATa heVLadehoVgu. 
\alnum{b} ele keLagiDu; ATadiMda nivaqtatxnAgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{16} obabx vayxkitxyiMda inonxbabxnige, oMdu sathxLadiMda inonxMdakekx vagARyisalapxDu.

\num{18} (\ame) (kariyana pUvaRjatavxviruva vayxkitxya \vi) biLiyaneMdu samamxtavAgu, opipxgepaDe.

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{has passed the chair} (hiMde) adhayxkaSx, meVyarf, \mo\ AgidAdxne. 
\num{2} \eng{pass a dividend} lABAMshavanunx koDadiru, parxkaTisade hoVgu, GoVSisadiru.

\numie
\numi{4} \eng{pass by} 
\banum
\alnum{a} keYbiDu; biTuTxbiDu; gamanisadiru; nilaRkiSxsu; upeVkiSxsu: \eng{I cannot pass the matter by without making a protest} nAnu parxtiBaTane sUcisade viSayavanunx keYbiDalAre. 
\alnum{b} noVDade yA nilalxde -- dATihoVgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} \eng{pass by the name of...} eMba hesariniMda -- rUDhiyAgu, baLakege baru, gotAtxgu, paricitavAgiru: \eng{the modification of civilization which passes by the name of `evolution of society'} `samAjada vikAsa' veMba hesariniMda rUDhige baMdiruva nAgarikateya mApARTu. 
\num{6} \eng{pass in one's} \hyperref{kandict_c.pdf}{C}{checks(2) nuga(2)}{$^2$check}\eng{s.} 
\num{7} \eng{pass} \hyperref{kandict_m.pdf}{M}{muster(1) pagu}{$^1$muster}.

\banum

\alnum{d} (eDavaTuTx saMdaBaRdiMda yA hiMdina parxsAtxpadiMda) beVreya kaDege gamana seLe, tirugisu; (saMdaBaR yA parxsAtxpa) gamanakekx bAradaMte tapipxsu: \eng{pass off an awkward situation} peVcina saMdaBaRvanunx beVreDege tirugisu.

\bmng
\bnum

\num{3} (vayxkitxgaLa \vi, AhAra \mo vanunx) koMcakoMcavAgi etitxkoMDu tinunx (\akirx\ saha). 
\num{4} (\AmA) tinunx. 
\num{5} (ecacxrikeyiMda, joVkeyiMda) Arisiko; hekukx; Ayu: \eng{pick one's words} (mAtanunx) joVpAnavAgi (huDuki) baLasu. 
\num{6} (hatitx \mo vanunx) eLedu beVpaRDisu; biDisu; hiMju. 
\num{7} (elubige aMTikoMDa mAMsavanunx) kiVLu; kitutx tege, beVpaRDisu. 
\num{8} (hakikxya \vi) (kALu \mo vanunx) kokikxniMda -- hekukx, etitxko. 
\num{9} (\ame) (taMtivAdayxgaLa) taMtigaLanunx miVTu. 
\num{10} aDugege muMce, \kanmu\ tarakArigaLiMda toTuTx \mo vugaLanunx tege. 
\num{11} dugaRma parxdeVshadalilx kAlanxDageyalilx hoVgalu ecacxrikeyiMda dAriyanunx Arisiko. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\hypertarget{pickpagu}{} 
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{pick a lock} (kaLaLxtanada udedxVshadiMda) biVga -- oDe, muri, tege; moLe, kaMbi, kaLaLxbiVgada keY, \mo vugaLiMda biVgatege. 
\hyperdef{P}{pick(3) pagu(2)}{} 
\num{2} \eng{pick and choose} ati joVkeyiMda Ayu, Arisu. 
\num{3} \eng{pick and steal} savxlapx savxlapxvAgi kadi. 
\num{4} \eng{pick person's brains} (tAnu sharxma vahisade, inonxbabxna aBipArxyagaLu, sharxma, budidhx, \mo vanunx) savxMta parxyoVjanakAkxgi baLasiko, duDisiko: \eng{he refused to prepare for the examination but counted on picking his friend's brain} avanu pariVkeSxge tAneV sidadhxnAguvudanunx biTuTx tananx senxVhitana jAcnxnavanunx baLasikoLaLxlu nidhaRrisida. 
\num{5} \eng{pick a quarrel with} jagaLa hUDu; jagaLa tege. 
\num{6} \eng{pick} \hyperref{kandict_h.pdf}{H}{hole(1)pagu}{$^1$holes} (\engit{or} \eng{a hole) in}. 
\numi{7} \eng{pick at} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (anAvashayxkavAgi, oMdeV samane) obabxralilx tapupx huDuku, doVSa kaMDuhiDi. 
\alnum{b} (keYyiMda) muTuTx; hiDiduko; hiDidubiDu: \eng{the baby picked at the mother's glass frames} maguvu tAyiya kananxDakada cwkaTaTxnunx hiDidukoMDitu. 
\alnum{c} (AhAravanunx) manasisxlalxde, iSaTxvilalxde -- (cUrucUru) tinunx. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{8} \eng{pick off} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (ele \mo vanunx) kitutxhAku. 
\alnum{b} (manuSayxru \mo varanunx) udedxVshapUvaRkavAgi obabxrAda meVlobabxraMte nidhAnavAgi ArisikoMDu guMDu hoDedu kolulx: \eng{the hunter picked off a duck rising from the marsh} beVTegAranu jwginiMda meVlakekx barutitxdadx bAtukoVLiyanunx ArisikoMDu guMDikikxkoMda. 
\alnum{c} (viroVdha \mo vanunx) EkAMgiyAgi ninARma mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{9} \eng{pick on} 
\banum
\alnum{a} doVSa huDuku; tapupx kaMDuhiDi. 
\alnum{b} Ayu; Arisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} \eng{pick one's steps} = \hyperlink{pickpagu11}{?pagu?\((11)\)}. 
\hypertarget{pickpagu11}{} 
\num{11} \eng{pick one's way} (huSArAgi) hejejx iDu; dAri noVDikoMDu naDe. 
\num{12} \eng{pick one's words} (mAtanunx) joVpAnavAgi (huDuki) Ayudx baLasu. 
\numi{13} \eng{pick out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} Ayu; Ayekx mADu; cunAyisu: \eng{pick out one's successor} tananx utatxrAdhikAriyanunx Arisu, cunAyisu. 
\alnum{b} (oMdu vasutxvina \vi) dUradiMda yA sutatxmutatxlina vasutxgaLiMda beVpaRDisi, vayxtAyxsa garxhisi -- gurutisu, gurutu hiDi, gurutu hacucx: \eng{pick out a well-known face in a crowd} guMpinalilx ciraparicitavAda muKavanunx gurutisu. 
\alnum{c} (oMdu vAkayx \mo vugaLa) athaR garxhisu; athaR mADiko. 
\alnum{d} (rAgavanunx) kiviyiMda keVLi adaraMte piyAnoV \mo vugaLa meVle nuDisu. 
\alnum{e} (vaNaRcitarx \mo vugaLanunx) beVroMdu baNaNxdiMda ujajxvXlagoLisu, edudx kANuvaMte mADu. 
\alnum{f} (alaMkAra, vaNaRcitarx, \mo vugaLanunx) viBinanx baNaNxdiMda etitxkUrisu: \eng{picked out the handles in red} keMpu baNaNxdiMda hiDigaLanunx etitxtoVriside. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{14} \eng{pick over} (iruvudaralilx) atuyxtatxmavAdudanunx Arisu. 
\num{15} \eng{pick a (person's) pocket} kisegaLaLxtana mADu; obabxna jeVbinalilxruvudanunx lapaTAyisu, kaLaLxtanadiMda egarisu. 
\numi{16} \eng{pick to pieces} 
\banum
\alnum{a} cUru cUrAgi kitutx hAku. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) (obabxna meVle) devxVSaBAvadiMda TiVke mADu; kaTuvAgi vimashiRsu; (obabxnanunx) tiVvarxvAgi KaMDisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{17} \eng{pick up} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (nela \mo vugaLiMda) hiDidetutx; tegedukoMDu meVlakekx etitxko: \eng{picked up his hat} hAyxTanunx keYgetitxgoMDa. 
\alnum{b} (AkasimxkavAgi yA sharxmavilalxde) paDeduko: \eng{picked up a cold} sumamxne negaDi aMTisikoMDa. 
\alnum{c} (inonxbabxra vashakekx opipxsidadx vayxkitx, pArxNi yA vasutxvanunx) hiMtaru; vApasutaru. 
\alnum{d} niMtu (\kanmu\ vAhanadalilx) joteyalilx oyuyx, karedukoMDu hoVgu: \eng{pick me up on the corner} mUleyalilx nililxsi nananxnunx hatitxsikoMDu hoVgu. 
\alnum{e} pArxsaMgikavAgi (\kanmu\ saMBoVgApeVkeSxyiMda vayxkitxya) paricaya beLesu, mADiko. 
\alnum{f} (AroVgayx, havAmAna, SeVrugaLa bele, \mo vugaLa \vi) ceVtarisiko; utatxmagoLuLx. 
\alnum{g} (moVTArina eMjinunx \mo vugaLa \vi) veVga hecAcxgu, hecicxsiko. 
\alnum{h} (poliVsu \mo vara \vi) hiDi; vashapaDisiko; dasatxgiri mADu. 
\alnum{i} (taniKe, pariVkeSx yA dUradashaRka, reVDiyoV, \mo vugaLa mUlaka) kaMDuhiDi; patetx hacucx: \eng{picked up a distress signal} Apatitxna saMkeVtavanunx patetx hacicxda. 
\alnum{j} (bilulx \mo vugaLanunx) pAvati mADuva javAbAdxri tegeduko, hoNevahisu. 
\alnum{k} (\AtAmx) keLakekx bidadx taruvAya matetx edudxnilulx. 
\alnum{l} neladiMda meVlakekx (kAlu \mo vanunx) etutx. 
\alnum{m} (gAlfphx ATadalilx) (\kanmu\ badadxnunx edurALige biTuTx koDuvAga) tananx ceMDanunx keYgetitxko. 
\alnum{n} (videVshiV BASe, taMtarx, \mo vanunx) aBAyxsamADi kali. 
\alnum{o} (gALimAtu, sudidx, \mo vanunx) keVLiko yA tiLiduko: \eng{picked up an interesting piece of news} oMdu sAvxrasayxkara sudidxyanunx keVLida. 
\alnum{p} (\eng{with} oDane) hosa senxVha beLesu; hosadAgi senxVhitananAnxgi mADiko; haLeya senxVhavanunx matetx sAthxpisu.

\bentry
\word[play(1)]{play}
\pron{pelxV}
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} parxyoVgisu; saliVsAgi upayoVgisu. 
\num{2} gALada huriyanunx eLedeLedu (miVnanunx) susutxbiVLisu, susAtxguvaMte mADu, susutxbiVLuvaMte mADu. 
\num{3} (beLakanunx) biVLisu; tirugisu; ADisu: \eng{play a searchlight on the clouds} shoVdhanadiVpagaLanunx moVDagaLa meVle tirugisu. 
\num{4} (taMtarx, kucoVdayx, hAsayx, \mo vanunx vayxkitxya meVle) naDasu ; mADu; parxyoVgisu: \eng{played a trick on me} nananx meVle kutaMtarx mADida. 
\num{5} (kirxkeTf, isipxVTu, \mo\ ATa) ADu. 
\num{6} (akataqRkavAgi saha) (kirxkeTf, Tenisf, \mo\ ATagaLalilx ceMDesetagAra ceMDanunx eseyuva, hoDeyuva modalu ATagAranige koDuva AdeVshavAgi) ADu. 
\numi{7} 
\banum
\alnum{a} ATadalilx (obabxna meVle) hoVrADu; (obabxnoDane) seNsu; sapxdhiRsu: \eng{will you play him at wrestling}? niVnu avana meVle kusitx ADutitxVyA? 
\alnum{b} (oMdu ATa yA manaraMjanA kAyaRkarxmadalilx) BAgavahisu. 
\alnum{c} (oMdu nidiRSaTx sAthxnadalilx) taMDadalilx ADu. 
\alnum{d} (\eng{play in, on, at,} \mo) (ATagAranige) nidiRSaTxsAthxna koDu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} (vayxkitxyanunx) ATavADalu neVmisu; ATagArara taMDadalilx seVrisu; ADisu: \eng{shall we play Smith in the next match}? muMdina paMdayxdalilx nAvu simxtfnanunx ADisoVNaveV? 
\num{9} (caduraMga \mo\ ATagaLalilx) kAyi naDasu: \eng{play a pawn} oMdu pAyxdeyanunx naDesu. 
\num{10} (isipxVTfnalilx tananx saradi baMdAga) ele iLi; elehAku. 
\num{11} (kirxkeTf \mo, ATagaLalilx) nidiRSaTxriVtiyalilx (\kanmu\ tananx kaDeya vikeTf, goVlu, \mo vanunx rakiSxsikoMDu) ceMDu hoDe. 
\num{12} (saMgiVtavAdayxvanunx) nuDisu; bAjisu. 
\num{13} (saMgiVtavanunx, saMgiVtada BAgavanunx) vAdayxda meVle nuDisu, bAjisu: \eng{he played an old tune on the flute} avanu koLalinalilx oMdu haLeya rAgavanunx nuDisidanu. 
\num{14} raMgasathxLada meVle (nATaka) ADu; parxdashiRsu: \eng{play `Hamlet'} hAyxmelxTf nATakavanunx ADu. 
\num{15} (nATaka, sinimA, \mo vugaLalilx pAtarxvanunx) aBinayisu; pAtarxvahisu: \eng{play Shylock} SeYlAkf pAtarxvahisu. 
\num{16} (\rUpa) vAsatxva jiVvanadalilx (oMdara pAtarxdaMte) naDedukoV, vatiRsu: \eng{play the fool} mUKaRnaMte ADu. \eng{play the man} gaMDinaMte naDe; pwruSadiMda vatiRsu. \eng{play truant} kelasakekx, shAlege tapipxsiko; cakakxrf hoDe. 
\num{17} (rekADfR, rekADfR pelxVyarf, \mo vanunx) cAlanegoLisu; dhavxniyuMTumADuvaMte mADu. 
\num{18} (vayxkitxyanunx) (nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx) parigaNisu; BAvisu: \eng{played me for a fool} nananxnunx mUKaRneMdu BAvisidanu. 
\num{19} jUjADu; bAji kaTuTx. 
\num{20} (\eng{play in, out}) saMgiVtadalilx vayxkitxya jotege bAjisu yA hADu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} ATavADu; kuNidADu; nalidADu; hArADu; negedADu; melalxge suLidADu; caTuvaTikeyiMda manabaMdaMte, ODADu: \eng{bees play about flowers} duMbigaLu hUvugaLa sutatx hArADutatxve. 
\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (ale, gALi, beLaku, \mo vu) haguravAgi baDi, tAgu, hoDe; suLidADu: \eng{wind plays on water} gALi niVrina meVle suLidADutatxde. 
\alnum{b} melalxge sapxshiRsu, tAgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} sutAtxDu; suLidADu; ililxMdalilxge calisu, vilAsavADu: \eng{his fancy played round the idea} avana kalapxneyu BAvaneya sutatx vilAsavADitu. 
\num{4} (yaMtarx \mo vugaLa BAgagaLu) saliVsAgi calisu; sarAgavAgi ADu: \eng{the piston rod plays within a cylinder} ADubeNeya saraLu siliMDarinoLage ADutatxde. 
\num{5} (baMdUku \mo vu) hAru; guMDuhoDe: \eng{the cannon on both sides began to play} eraDu kaDeyU PiraMgi hAralu pArxraMBavAyitu. 
\num{6} vinoVdavAgi kAla kaLe; vinoVdavADu; kirxVDisu; viharisu; ATavADu: \eng{to play with fools, what a fool was I}! mUKaRroDane vinoVdavAgi kAla kaLeyalu nAneMtha mUKaRnAgidedx! 
\num{7} (\pArxparx) (\kanmu\ muSakxra hUDiruva kelasagArara \vi) kelasakekx hoVgade niMtubiDu: \eng{of the 70{,}000 men playing 40{,}000 are nonunionists} kelasakekx hoVgade niMta \eng{$70{,}000$} janagaLa peYki \eng{$40{,}000$} saMGeVtararu. 
\num{8} tamASegAgi vatiRsu, soVguhAku, naTisu: \eng{let us play that we are gypsies} nAvu jipisxgaLeMdu tamASegAgi naTisoVNa. 
\num{9} jUjADu: \eng{played for heavy stakes} BAri haNa kaTiTx jUjADidanu. 
\num{10} (saMgiVta vAdayxda meVle) nuDisu; bAjisu. 
\num{11} (\AmA) BAgavahisu; sahakarisu; mADabeVkAdadxnunx mADu: \eng{they won't play} avaru (mADabeVkAdadxnunx) mADuvudilalx. 
\num{12} (kirxkeTf meYdAnada \vi) nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx ATakekx anukUlavAgiru: \eng{the pitch is playing fast} picucx veVgada boVliMgige anukUlavAgide. 
\num{13} (\AmA) oMdu nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx naDe, vatiRsu: \eng{play fair} sariyAgi, nAyxyavAgi vatiRsu. 
\num{14} (nATaka \mo vugaLalilx) pAtarxvoMdanunx vahisu, aBinayisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{play about} (\engit{or} \eng{around)} beVjavAbAdxriyiMda naDeduko, vatiRsu. 
\num{2} \eng{play a good} \hyperref{kandict_k.pdf}{K}{knife(1) nuga(5)}{$^1$knife} \eng{and fork}. 
\num{3} \eng{play a good stick} katitxvarase cenAnxgi mADu. 
\num{4} \eng{play along} sahakarisuvaMte naTisu, naTanemADu. 
\numi{5} \eng{play at} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (ATadalilx) toDagu; ATavADu. 
\alnum{b} ATadaMte ADu yA mADu; mADuvaMte naTisu; asharxdedhxyiMda kaLapeyAgi, are manasisxniMda (hoVrATa \mo vanunx) mADu: \eng{he was only playing at boxing} avanu keVvala muSiTxkALagada ATavADutitxdadx; avanu are manasisxniMda mAtarx muSiTxkALagavanunx mADutitxdadx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{play back} (\kanmu\ dhavxni mudarxNagaLa guNamaTaTxvanunx noVDi niyaMtirxsalu, sadayxdalilx mudirxsida dhavxnigaLanunx) matetx hAku; punarAvatiRsu; matetx keVLisuvaMte mADu. 
\num{7} \eng{play ball} (ATavanunx) AraMBisu; ATavanunx muMduvarisu; matetx AraMBisu; sahakarisu: \eng{you play ball with me and I'll play ball with you} niVnu nanonxDane sahakarisidare nAnu ninanx jote sahakarisutetxVne. 
\num{8} \eng{play both ends against the middle} (tananx lABakokxVsakxra) viroVdha guMpugaLanunx oMdara meVloMdu etitxkaTuTx. 
\hyperdef{P}{play(1) pagu(9)}{} 
\numi{9} \eng{play by ear} 
\banum
\alnum{a} keVLemxyiMda nuDisu; saMgiVtada savxraparxsAtxrada liKita puTada neravilalxde vAdayxvanunx nuDisu, bAjisu. 
\alnum{b} (\eng{play it by ear} saha) pariNAma matutx saMdaBaRgaLige anusAravAgi sahaja parxvaqtitxyiMda yA hejejxhejejxyAgi muMduvari. 
\alnum{c} (obabxna shakitxyanunx toVrisuvaMtha aniriVkiSxta saMdaBaRdalilx) thaTakakxne yoVcisikoMDu heVLu, mADu, kalipxsu: \eng{faced by his two wives he had to play it by ear} ibabxru heMDatiyaru avana eduru niMtAga avanu thaTakakxne EnanonxV kalipxsikoMDu heVLabeVkAyitu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} \eng{play (congregation etc.,) in (}\engit{or} \eng{out)} (taMDa \mo vu oLage baruvAga yA horage hoVguvAga) AgaRnf vAdayxvanunx bAjisu. 
\numi{11} \eng{play down} 
\banum
\alnum{a} keLakikxLisu; mahatavx kaDamemADu; alapxvAgeNisu; kaDegaNisu; aparxdhAnaveMdu BAvisu: \eng{he has played down his own part in this successful enterprise} I yashasivx udayxmadalilx tananx pAtarxvanenxV alapxvAgeNisidAdxne. 
\alnum{b} (oMdara, obabxna) mahatavxvanunx, pArxmuKayxvanunx -- iLisu, tagigxsu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{12} \eng{play ducks and} \hyperref{kandict_d.pdf}{D}{drake(2) nuga}{$^2$drake}\eng{s.} 
\numi{13} \eng{played out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} shakitxyelAlx kugigxhoVda; satavx hiVridaMtAda; satavxguMdida; susAtxda: \eng{our horses were played out} namamx kuduregaLu shakitxyilalxde susAtxdavu. 
\alnum{b} kelasakekx bArade hoVda; upayoVgakekx bArada; parxyoVjanakekx baradaMtAda: \eng{free trade is played out} mukatxvAyxpArada dinagaLu mugidive; mukatx vAyxpAradiMda Iga yAva parxyoVjanavU ilalx. 
\eanum
\numie

\num{7} vivikatx parxdeVshagaLu yA janara guMpugaLu: \eng{pockets of resistance} parxtiBaTaneya parxdeVshagaLu yA taMDagaLu. 
\num{8} = \hyperref{kandict_a.pdf}{A}{air pocket}{air pocket}. 
\numi{9}(visheVSaNavAgi) 
\banum

\numie

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{be in one's pocket} 
\banum
\alnum{a} obabxna jeVbinalilx, vashadalilx, keYyalilx iru: \eng{she has him in her pocket} avaLu avananunx tananx jeVbinalilx iTuTxkoMDidAdxLe.

\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{empty pocket} KAlijeVbu; KAlijeVbinavanu; haNavilalxdavanu. 
\numi{3} \eng{in pocket} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (haNada \vi) hatitxra iruva; laBayxvAgiruva. 
\alnum{b} vAyxpAradalilx gaLisida: \eng{I am Rs. 5 in pocket by this transaction} I vAyxpAradiMda nananx jeVbige \eng{5} rUpAyi baMtu; I vAyxpAradiMda nanage \eng{5} rUpAyi lABavAyitu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{4} \eng{out of pocket} vAyxpAradalilx kaLedukoMDa, naSaTxvAda: \eng{I am Rs. 5 out of pocket by this transaction} I vAyxpAra mADidadxkekx nananx jeVbige \eng{5} rUpAyi naSaTxvAyitu, hoVyitu. 
\num{5} \eng{out-of pocket expenses} tananx jeVbiniMdaleV mADida KacuRgaLu; ainf vecacxgaLu. 
\numi{6} \eng{put one's hand in one's pocket} 
\banum
\alnum{a} haNa KacuR mADu. 
\alnum{b} haNa koDu yA odagisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} \eng{put one's pride in one's pocket} mAnavanunx, aBimAnavanunx otatxTiTxgiDu; mAnApamAnavanunx (sadayxkekx) mare; mAnakekx kaDameyAdadadxnunx mADalu opipxko.

\bentry

\bnum
\num{1} (saNaNx) cukekx; biMdu. 
\num{2} pUNaRvirAma (cihenx). 
\num{3} (semiTikf BASegaLalilx savxragaLanunx sUcisalu yA vayxMjanagaLa vayxtAyxsa toVrisalu baLasuva) cukekx; biMdu; tiVra saNaNxgere.

\num{5} aMsha; vivara; bAbu: \eng{we differ on these points} I aMshagaLalilx namamxlilx BinAnxBipArxyavide. 
\num{6} (parxdashaRnakAkxgi iTiTxruva oMdu vasutxvina mwlayxmApanadalilx EkamAnavAgi iTuTxkoLuLxva) sUcayxMka; aMka.

\num{8} QuNasaMcayada bele \mo vanunx GoVSisuvAga baLasuva(EriLitakokxLapaTaTx) EkamAna; pAyiMTu: \eng{prices on the stock exchange advanced by two points} sATxkfekfsxceVMjinalilx belegaLu eraDu pAyiMTugaLaSuTx Erive. 
\num{9} (mudarxNa) acicxna moLegaLa gAtarxda EkamAna (birxTanf matutx amerikagaLalilx \eng{$0.0138$} aMguladaSuTx). 
\num{10} (\jAyx) biMdu; sAthxna mAtarx uLaLx Adare udadx, agala, dapapx ilalxda Akaqti. 
\num{11} KacitavAda -- sathxLa, sAthxna; biMdu: \eng{point of contact} saMgamasAthxna; saMgama biMdu \eng{Bombay and points east} boMbAyi matutx pwrasatxyX sathxLagaLu. 
\num{12} pAyiMTu; vajarxda oMdu mAna \eng{(2 mg)}. 
\numi{13} (beVTe) 
\banum
\alnum{a} neVravAgi ODi muTuTxva -- sAthxna, nele, guri. 
\alnum{b} iMtha sAthxnavanunx muTaTxlu ODuva OTa. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{14} (\vaMlAM) gurANiya meVle sAthxnavanunx niNaRyisuva saluvAgi mADiruva oMbatutx cukikxgaLalilx, biMdugaLalilx oMdu. 
\num{15} (\kanmu\ uSaNxteya \vi) oMdu kirxyeya -- haMta, GaTaTx; biMdu: \eng{boiling point} kudibiMdu. \eng{freezing point} GaniVBavanabiMdu. 
\num{16} (kelasa \mo vanunx mADalu) nishicxta, nidiRSaTx -- kAla veVLe, hotutx, muhUtaR, samaya: \eng{when it came to the point, he declined} veVLe baMdAga avanu AguvudilalxveMda. 
\num{17} kulxpatx, nidiRSaTx yA niyamita -- kAla, veVLe, hotutx, GaLige, muhUtaR: \eng{point of death} sAvina GaLige. 
\num{18} vishiSaTx guNa, lakaSxNa; veYshiSaTxyX; \eng{singing is not his strong point} hADuvudu avana veYshiSaTxyXveVnU alalx. 
\num{19} parxkaqta aMsha; sadayxkekx agatayxvAda viSaya adeV. \eng{come to the point} (parxkaqta) viSayakekx baru, bA. 
\num{20} (pUtiRyAgi sUjiyiMda holidu mADida) kasUti dArada heNige. 
\num{21} (tapupx \parx) kasUtidArada heNigeyanunx anukarisida talediMbina kasUti (kelasa). 
\num{22} (upakaraNa, ayudha, guMDusUji, leVKani, \mo vugaLa) mone; monacutudi. 
\num{23} tudi; kone. 
\numi{24} 
\banum
\alnum{a} BUshira. 
\alnum{b} beTaTxda koVDu, tudi; pavaRtashaqMga (\kanmu\ sathxLagaLa hesarugaLalilx \parx): \eng{Start Point} sATxTfR pAyiMTf BUshira. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{25} (seYnayx) muMgAvalu seVneya muMcUNi; muMgApu seYnayxda agarxdaLa. 
\num{26} (nAyi, kudure, \mo vugaLa) tudiBAgagaLu; muMtudi matutx hiMtudi: \eng{bay with black points} tudiBAgagaLu kapApxgiruva keMcukudure. 
\num{27} moneyAgiruva upakaraNa, Ayudha, \udA\ \eng{etching needle} kore sUji. 
\num{28} sAraMgada, (gaMDu)jiMkeya koMbina mone; kuraMgashaqMga. 
\num{29} (\birx) (\sA\ \bava dalilx) (reYlumAgaR) reYlugADiyu oMdu reYlu mAgaRdiMda inonxMdakekx hoVgalu neravAgi hAkiruva, savxlapxmaTiTxge kadalisabalalx, monacu kaMb; horaLugaMbi.

\num{32} (\nw) hAyiya keLaaMcanunx meVlakekx muduri kaTaTxlu baLasuva saNaNx hagagx.

\num{8} \eng{reciprocal pronoun} anoyxVnayx saMbaMdha(sUca)ka savaRnAma \eng{(one aother, each other)}. 
\num{9} \eng{reflexive pronoun} AtAmxthaRka, sAvxthaRka savaRnAma \eng{(myself, oneself).}

\num{3} rujuvAtu mADuvudu; daqDhapaDisuvudu: \eng{not capable of proof} rujuvAtu mADalu sAdhayxvilalx. 
\num{4} (sAkxTelxMDf \nAyxshA) nAyxyadashiRgaLa badalu nAyxyAdhiVshara muMde naDeyuva vicAraNe. 
\hypertarget{proof(1)5}{} 
\num{5} pariVkeSx: \eng{will stand a severe proof} kaThiNa pariVkeSxge nilulxtatxde. \eng{the proof of the pudding is in the eating} (yAvudaradeV) nijavAda mwlayx parxtayxkASxnuBavadiMda mAtarx sidadhx; (kaDubina) pariVkeSxyAguvudu adanunx tiMdAga mAtarx; kaDubu mADidadxkekx, kaDubina rucige adanunx tiMdidedxV parxmANa. 
\num{6} (\pArxparx) pariVkeSx mADi noVDida aBeVdayxte: \eng{armour of proof} aBeVdayx yudadhxkavaca. 
\num{7} (Asavita mAdaka pAniVyagaLa \vi\ avugaLalilxruva) AlakxhAlf sArateya parxmANa: \eng{proof spirit} parxmANaka sArateyuLaLx niVru AlakxhAlfgaLa misharxNa. 
\num{8} (mudarxNa) (aMtimavAgi mudirxsuvudakekx modalu tapupx tidudxvudu \mo vakAkxgi, joVDisida acucxmoLegaLiMda tegeda) karaDacucx.

\alnum{b} (\tashA) samaseyxyanunx biDisuva parxkirxye yA parxkirxyeyalilx oMdu haMta. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} (ketitxda mudarxNa PalakadiMda mudarxNaparxtigaLanunx tegeyuva modalu, \sA\ aMkita \mo vanunx hAkuvudakekx muMce, joVkeyiMda tegeda, savxlapxsaMKeyxya) muMparxti(gaLalolxMdu). 
\hypertarget{proof(1)11}{} 
\num{11} (Ayekx \mo vugaLigAgi mADida) CAyAcitarxda parxti, pirxMTu.

\noindent

\num{3} \eng{engraver's proof} nakAsegArana karaDacucx. 
\num{4} \eng{be living proof of (something)} jiVvaMtasAkaSxyXvAgiruva; tAnu badukiruva mUlaka (oMdara satayxte, parxyoVjakate, \mo vanunx) nidashiRsu: \eng{living proof of the power of non-violence} ahiMsAshakitxya jiVvaMta sAkaSxyX.

\bentry
\word[pull(1)]{pull}
\pron{pulf}
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (tananx kaDege) eLe; seLe; tuyuyx; jagugx: \eng{don't pull my hair} nananx kUdalanunx eLeyabeVDa. 
\num{2} (I riVti) baruvaMte eLeduko: \eng{pull it nearer} adanunx inUnx hatitxrakekx eLeduko. 
\num{3} eLeyuva mUlaka -- calisuvaMte mADu. 
\num{4} atiyAda otatxDa, BAra, \mo vugaLiMda (sAnxyu \mo vugaLige) gAsi mADu; jaKaM mADu; hAni mADu. 
\num{5} (piVpAyiyiMda biyaru \mo vanunx) seLe; eLe; tege. 
\num{6} (giDavanunx) beVrusahita kiVLu; buDasahita kitutxhAku; mUloVtApxTana mADu. 
\num{7} (biraDe, halulx, \mo vanunx) eLedu kiVLu; eLedu hAku. 
\num{8} (hALeya meVle) CApisu; mudirxsu; acucxmADu. 
\num{9} parxtiyanunx etutx. 
\num{10} karaDacucx tege. 
\num{11} (huTuTxhAki) doVNi naDesu. 
\num{12} (\ashi) sere hiDi; dasatxgiri mADu. 
\num{13} (\ashi) (jUjina mane \mo vugaLige nugigx) dALimADu. 
\num{14} (paMdayxdalilx kudureyu soVluvaMte adara) lagAmeLedu taDe. 
\num{15} (kirxkeTf) (boVlu) mADida ceMDanunx (AphfseYDiniMda legf seYDige) hoDe (\akirx\ saha). 
\num{16} (gAlfphx) (ceMDanunx) eDagaDe dUrakekx hoDe (\akirx\ saha). 
\num{17} (obabxna meVle parxyoVgisalu cAku, katitx, baMdUku, \mo vanunx ore, ciVla, \mo vugaLiMda) (hora) seLe; (horakekx) eLe. 
\num{18} (beMbala)gaLisu; paDe. 
\num{19} (girAkiyanunx) seLe; AkaSiRsu. 
\num{20} (\AmA) (\sA\ nAyxyabAhiravAdudanunx) sAdhisu yA paDeduko. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (jagigx) eLe: \eng{the horse pulls well} kudure cenAnxgi eLeyutatxde. \eng{pulled away at the handle} hiDiyanunx hiDidu jagigx eLeda. 
\num{2} (obabxna paravAgi tananx) parxBAvavanunx baLasu, parxyoVgisu: \eng{he always pulls for the underdog} sadA avanu tananx parxBAvavanunx diVnadalitara paravAgi baLasutAtxne. 
\num{3} (beTaTx \mo vugaLa meVlakekx) parxyAsadiMda Eru, hatutx yA eLedukoMDu hoVgu. 
\num{4} (kudureya \vi, \kanmu\ aBAyxsabaladiMda) kaDivANavanunx jagugx, eLe, tuyuyx. 
\num{5} (doVNiya \vi) (huTuTx hAkuvudariMda) muMde sAgu; calisu: \eng{the boat pulled ashore} doVNiyu tiVrada kaDege calisitu. \eng{the boat pulls by six oars} A doVNiyu Aru huTuTxgaLiMda naDeyutatxde. 
\num{6} (cuMgANi \mo vanunx) seVdu; eLe. 
\num{7} (usiranunx) diVGaRvAgi eLeduko. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{pull about} 
\banum
\alnum{a} atatx itatx eLe, eLedADu. 
\alnum{b} (obabxna jote) oraTAgi vatiRsu; (obabxnanunx) oraToraTAgi naDesiko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{pull a} \hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{face(1) nuga(15)}{$^1$face}. 
\num{3} \eng{pull a} \hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{fast(3) nuga(3)}{$^3$fast} \eng{one.} 
\num{4} \eng{pull ahead} (yAvudanAnxdarU, yAranAnxdarU) hAyudx muMde hoVgu. 
\numi{5} \eng{pull along} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (\AmA) kAyileyiMda guNa hoMdu. 
\alnum{b} (\AmA) saMkaTadiMda yA duHsithxtiyiMda ceVtarisiko. 
\alnum{c} kAyileyiMda guNapaDisu yA duHsithxtiyiMda susithxtige taru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{pull a long face} joVlumoVre hAku. 
\num{7} \eng{pull a person to pieces} (vayxkitxyanunx) cUrucUru mADu; kaTuvAgi KaMDisu. 
\numi{8} \eng{pull apart (}\engit{or} \eng{to pieces)} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (vasutxvoMdara) aMgaBAgagaLanunx -- kaLacihAku, kitutxhAku, beVpaRDisu. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) (vayxkitxyanunx, vasutxvanunx) kaTuvAgi TiVkisu; niSuThxravAgi KaMDisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} \eng{pull a person's} \hyperref{kandict_l.pdf}{L}{leg(1) nuga(13)}{$^1$leg}. 
\num{10} \eng{pull a thing to pieces} (vasutxvanunx) balavaMtavAgi bicicx (adara) BAgagaLanunx kaLacihAku, kitutxhAku. 
\num{11} \eng{pull back} himemxTuTx yA himemxTiTxsu; hiMdakekx baru yA barisu. 
\num{12} \eng{pull caps (}\engit{or} \eng{wigs)} (\pArxparx) seNasATa; jagaLa; kitAtxTa. 
\numi{13} \eng{pull down} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (\kanmu\ kaTaTxDavanunx) keDavu; uruLisu; nelasamamADu. 
\alnum{b} avamAna mADu. 
\alnum{c} (\AmA) (kUli, saMbaLa, \mo vugaLa rUpadalilx) haNavanunx gaLisu. 
\alnum{d} (roVgada \vi) dubaRlagoLisu; nishashxkatxvAgisu. 
\alnum{e} (AroVgayx, utAsxha, bele, \mo vu) iLi; kugugx; kusi. 
\hypertarget{pullpagu14b}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{14} \eng{pull in} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (basusx, reYlu, \mo vugaLa \vi) parxyANikaranunx hatitxsikoLaLxlu nilAdxNakekx baru, Agamisu. 
\alnum{b} (vAhanada \vi) rasetxya badige yA rasetxyAcege baru. 
\alnum{c} (haNa, veVtana, lABa, \mo vugaLanunx) gaLisu; paDe: \eng{pulls in Rs. 5000} aidu sAvira tarutAtxne, gaLisutAtxne. 
\alnum{d} (\AmA) dasatxgiri mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{15} \eng{pull in one's belt} (\AmA) hoTeTx kaTuTx: \eng{as food is scarce, we have to pull in our belts} AhAra korateyiruvudariMda nAvu hoTeTx kaTaTxbeVkAgide.

\banum

\alnum{b} gelulx; jayagaLisu. 
\alnum{c} uDupu \mo vanunx eLedu kaLacu, tege. 
\eanum
\numie

\num{18} \eng{pull on one's stockings} kAluciVlavanunx meVlakekx eLeduko. 
\num{19} \eng{pull one's ears} (daMDanegAgi) obabxna kivi eLe; obabxnanunx kivi hiDidu eLe; obabxnanunx daMDisu. 
\num{20} \eng{pull oneself together} ceVtarisiko; sAvxsathxyXgaLisiko; (duHKa \mo vugaLiMda) savxsithxtige hiMdirugu. matetx tananx meVlina hatoVTi paDeduko; matetx sAvxtamxniyaMtarxNa gaLisiko. 
\num{21} \eng{oneself up by one's (own) bootstraps} (\AmA) beVrobabxra neravilalxde tananx savxMta parxyatanxgaLa mUlakaveV tananx sithxtiyanunx utatxmapaDisiko. 
\num{22} \eng{pull one's nose (}\engit{or} \eng{pull one by the nose)} (apamAna mADalu) obabxna mUganunx eLe; obabxnanunx mUgu hiDidu eLe; obabxnanunx avamAna mADu. 
\num{23} \eng{pull one's punches} (muSiTx kALaga) tananx hoDetagaLalilx tananx balavanenxlAlx baLasadiru, parxyoVgisade hoVgu (\rUpa\ saha): \eng{in warning them he did not pull any punches} avaranunx ecacxrisuvudaralilx avanu tananx shakitxyanunx pUtiRyAgi baLasalilalx. 
\num{24} \eng{pull one's sleeve (}\engit{or} \eng{pull one by the sleeve)} (gamana seLeyalu) obabxna aMgiyanunx eLe; obabxna gamanavanunx seLe. 
\num{25} \eng{pull one's socks up} hecucx parxyatanx mADu: \eng{don't be easy-going, pull your socks up} viramisabeVDa, hecucx parxyatanx mADu. 
\numi{26} \eng{pull one's weight} 
\banum
\alnum{a} tananx balavanenxlAlx parxyoVgisi huTuTxhAku, hoDe. 
\alnum{b} tananx BAgada kelasa -- mADu, nivaRhisu. 
\alnum{c} tananx keYyalAlxdadadxnenxlAlx mADu; savaR parxyatanxvanUnx mADu; tananx balavanenxlAlx, parxBAvavanenxlAlx parxyoVgisu.

\numie
\numi{27} \eng{pull out}

\alnum{c} udayxmavoMdariMda hiMtegeduko. 
\alnum{d} (reYlu, basusx, \mo vu) nilAdxNa biDu; nilAdxNadiMda horaDu.
